titleStmt.title: SII 7.174: original edition by K.V. Subrahmanya Aiyer
No. 174. (A.R. No. 14 of 1901). ON A SLAB SET UP IN FRONT OF THE KINALUR TEMPLE IN PANANGAD-AMSAM, KURUMBRANAD TALUK, SAME DISTRICT.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī tirukkāḷicappaṭārark
ku tiruva ñcetu cellāniṉṟa yāṇṭu
nūṟṟeṇpattoṉpatāmāṇṭu makarattuḷ
viyāḻan niṟka meṭañāyiṟṟuḷ
p putaṉāṇ ṭaviṭṭattu nāḷk ku
ṇaviyanallūr vicaiyarākiccu
varattu paṭārarkku niccaṉaṭaik
ku nāṉāḻi yariyun nantāviḷa
kkiraṇṭuṉṉukkuṅ kū kiṟunāḻi
piṭikkun tūṇiyāl nālppatu po
ti kka tiruppalikkuñ cāntikku
ṅ kuṭaikkuṅ kukkiṟkuñ cantaṇat
tiṉukkum paḷḷittāmattiṉukkum
pūrappāṉ kuñciyāyiṉa kuṟu
mpuṟai Arttaṅ koṇṭu tiruva
ñcakkaḷattu cāttaṉarukakkaṭi
kku kārāṇmai kuṭutta Ūr taṉ
kūṟu kāṉtapuramum muṭakka
raiyūrum paiṅkaṇṭattūruṅ
kuraṭṭiyum paralāṭu mivai kārā
ṇmai vāḻntu celavu celuttak
kaṭavaḷ celuttavallā k
kirunāḻit tūṇiyāl nūṟṟirupa
tu poti nel mukkālvaṭṭat taḷavu
kuṭukkakaṭavaḷ Ōrāṇṭṭu muṭṭu ki
lak kaṭi viṭakkaṭavaḷ te
varkku cāttaṉarukkaṭi muṭṭāyiṉ
ñāyiṟukoyiṟkuṉṟuṅ kuḷa ceri
kkaḻiyuṅ kārāṇmai vāḻntu tirup
palik kaiṅkalan nel kuṭukkaka
ṭavaḷ kuṉṟañciṟunaṅkai muvāṇṭu
kaḻiñ ñāṭṭāṇ ṭaiññāḻittūṇi
yāl mukkalan neṟ ku
ṭukkakkaṭavaḷ kuṉṟañceṟuna
ṅkai kuṇavayanallūrt tevark
ku kuṟaṭṭiyā loru nantāviḷak
ku celuttakkaṭavaḷ cāttaṉarukka
ṭi tevakiṉaṭaip puraiyiṭaṅ kā
rāṇmai vāḻntu vicaiyaraākiccu
varattu viraccikaviḷakku ce
luttakkaṭavaṉ cāttaṉ cirikaṇ
ṭaṉ maṉukulaicekaranallūr vaṭak
kiṉ karaiyārappaṉ kuñciyāyi
ṉa kuṟumpuṟai taṉ kūṟu kuṇavaya
nallūr tevarkku niccaṉaṭai yi
runāḻiyu makkiramoṉṟuṅ ku vi
raṇṭiṉukkuṅ kuttāṟc celutti
kārāṇmai ceyyakkaṭavaṉ cāttañ ci
rikaṇṭaṉ Orāṇṭu muṭṭi paṇi vi
ṭakkaṭavaṉ pali kaḷavu koṭukaṭa ve
ḻunūṟṟuvaruṅ kārāḷaṉu muvvāyi
ravarun tiruttu celuttik koḷ
ḷakkaṭavar Aṟam pātukākka .
Digital edition of SII 7.174 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Dorotea Operato.
